boat.name: Felicis
boat.full_description:
Felicis is a Mitchell Sea Ranger built in Brightlingsea.  In 1954 Brightlingsea boatbuilder Fred Mitchell designed a 12 foot clinker general purpose dinghy with a small jib and modest mainsail on a gunter rig. His first customer was Mrs. Nicholl, who ran the Brightlingsea Sea Rangers.

Felicis was kept at the Gunfleet Sailing Club for many years before moving to Walton and Frinton Yacht Club.
boat.short_description: Felicis is a Mitchell Sea Ranger built in Brightlingsea; number 110 with Gunter rig.

for_sales.sales_text:
Felicis is Mitchell Sea Ranger no 110 built in mahogany. She comes complete with two sets of sails. Trailer not included.

At the moment she has been out of the water for a few years and kept in a garage so is completely dried out. Many of the roves have come loose and so the whole boat really needs re-fastening. There are also some planks with splits on the lands and so some repairs will be needed. Ideally she should go to someone who wants a project to bring her back to life as I do not have the time do it myself.

I will deliver to a reasonable distance (<= 100 miles from Cambridge).
